page.title: 10Footpaths and Bridleways
page.content: There are five marked footpaths, three of which are also bridleways (you can take horses down a bridleway but not down a footpath). One of the bridleways is a 'Green Lane', formerly a 'Carters' Lane', along which the cattle were taken to market without having to go on the 'main' roads. Many footpaths lead to bridges, so that you can cross the rivers, and some, including two new footpaths, lead to the historic Hoar Stones in the grounds of Barton Lodge. The new paths also link up the main A34 road with Middle Barton village. A local fieldpaths group helps to keep the paths clear and often walks them.
